newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - May 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - May 1.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on the front page of its business section on May 1:
WASHINGTON - The economy surged in the first quarter, growing at a 5.6 percent annual rate, while inflation remained stable, the Commerce Department reported.
NEW YORK - Stock prices pushed higher as investors chose to interpret the report that the U.S. economy grew at a strong 5.6 percent in the first quarter as good news.
WASHINGTON - The Justice Department said it was investigating "possible anti-competitive conduct" in federal auctions of licences to operate advanced wireless phone services.
WASHINGTON - Comsat Corp named board member Edwin Colodny and former USAir chief executive officer as chairman of the Bethesda satellite company.
